results.title: Samson and Delilah
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description: Cecil B. De Mille’s famous epic style is highlighted in this classic bible story about the legendary strongman Samson and the temptress Delilah, who helped destroy him. Lauded for its lush cinematography, performances, costumes, sets and special effects, it was a box office smash.

constellations_other.name: Swords, sandals and lightning bolts
constellations_other.description: In Thor: Love and Thunder, Russell Crowe plays one of the most recogniseable gods in the pantheon – Zeus. His scenes lampoon his Oscar-winning role in Gladiator, one of the most recognised films in a classic genre.

constellations_other.name: Religion, cinema and censorship
constellations_other.description: Religious narratives and themes have a complicated relationship with censorship, with creators pushing the boundaries for better or worse.

results.description: Cecil B. De Mille’s famous epic style is highlighted in this classic Bible story about the legendary strongman Samson, and the temptress Delilah, who seduced, betrayed and helped to destroy him. Victor Mature is the classic Samson; strong, brave and fearless as he wrestles lions and Philistines bare-handed. Hedy Lamarr is stunning as Delilah; in an array of dazzling and seductive costumes. Action packed, this Biblical epic is a spectacle to enjoy. Also stars George Sanders and Angela Lansbury.
description_for_label: Cecil B. De Mille’s famous epic style is highlighted in this classic Bible story about the legendary strongman Samson, and the temptress Delilah, who seduced, betrayed and helped to destroy him. Victor Mature is the classic Samson; strong, brave and fearless as he wrestles lions and Philistines bare-handed. Hedy Lamarr is stunning as Delilah; in an array of dazzling and seductive costumes. Action packed, this Biblical epic is a spectacle to enjoy. Also stars George Sanders and Angela Lansbury.

results.title: Samoa: I can get another wife but I can't get any parents
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
This film is one of a series that examines the Pacific Islands and the conflict, within them, between the modern world and traditional lifestyles. The film looks at ancient customs in Western Samoa as well as the social problems of the present such as overpopulation and unemployment that force thousands of Samoans overseas in search of a better life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Samoa I Sisifo
results.creator_credit: Juniper Films, Dan Tristam and Jamie Wilson
results.brief_description: Portrays the interweaving of traditional values and progressive development of the Samoan islanders giving an overall coverage of the people and their lifestyle. Covers also the tourist industry and shows the celebration of Western Samoa’s 10th anniversary of independence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Juniper Films, Dan Tristam and Jamie Wilson

results.title: Samoa [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: A graphic insight into the lives of the people of Samoa, an idyllic island group in the South Pacific, with a gentle climate, rich soil. Mountain peaks, and abundant water. Describes some f the elaborate ceremonies and customs developed by the Samoans. Shows the collecting and processing of copra, the principle export.

results.title: Samoa
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and Stanhope Andrews
results.brief_description: A survey of native life, customs and cultural activities in Western Samoa. The islanders are seen at work - making baskets, and copra, picking coconuts, bread0frut, and bananas, building a church, and fishing. Glimpses inside hospitals and medical centres illustrate the work being undertaken in safeguarding the health of the native. Recreational activities include Samoa cricket, singing and dancing.

results.title: Sammy Blue
results.creator_credit: Isabel Perez, Kim Farrant and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Sammy Blue is a young boy who wants to escape from the white noise of reality in his everyday life. If only he could be just like his goldfish “Blue” and swim around the bowl – forgetting everything, living moment by moment.
Features Andrew S. Gilbert as father, Claire Paradine as mother, William Balmford as Sammy and Zoe Carides as Mary.

results.title: Same difference: all about twins
results.brief_description: Discusses Siamese twins, how different twins are formed and how, with some, the bond is so close that they can feel each other’s pain. A fascinating study that looks at different types of twins including dissimilar twins and those that prefer to live separate lives.

results.title: Samba to slow fox
results.brief_description: A highly entertaining documentary about Australian ballroom dancing, from the competition glamour to interviews with the people inside the dancing shoes. This will appeal even to those who don’t know the difference between a samba and a slow fox. Rated: G

results.title: Sam Weller and his father
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Shows Sam Weller and his father collaborating on a plan to get Mr Pickwick out of the debtor’s prions and finally managing to give the detestable Mr Stiggins, a lay preacher, a sharp lesson. From the series “Tales from Dickens.”
